version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> User interface input status symbols

emoji_net_data.name: input symbols

bn:13728862a: Expressed in percents; usually together with a number.

bn:00097623a: Of or containing various different kinds.
Comprised of a number of different kinds or types; mixed; miscellaneous.
Of many different kinds purposefully arranged but lacking any uniformity

bn:00111563a: Of, related to, or being a symbol; symbolic
Relating to or using or proceeding by means of symbols

bn:00089764v: To enter data into a system.
Enter (data or a program) into a computer

bn:00094698v: To be symbolic of; to represent.
Represent or identify by using a symbol; use symbols

bn:00475539n: A single formed character or symbol, usually representing a letter in a font
A visual representation of a letter, character, or symbol, in a specific font and style.

In typography, a glyph is an elemental symbol within an agreed set of symbols, intended to represent a readable character for the purposes of writing and thereby expressing thoughts, ideas and concepts.
A graphical representation of either a character, a part of a character, or a sequence of characters.

bn:00053450n: A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened.

bn:00061135n: A proposed protocol standard that supports authentication and encryption to secure privacy in Internet communications. PCT is similar to the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocol.
In mathematics, a percentage is a number or ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.
The amount, number or rate of something, regarded as part of a total of 100; a part of a whole.
A proportion in relation to a whole (which is usually the amount per hundred)
Number or ratio as a fraction of 100
Ratio expressed as a number between 0 and 100, often denoted with the sign "%".
A ratio expressed as a number out of 100.

bn:00003054n: In computer science and mathematical logic, a non-empty set is called alphabet when its intended use in string operations shall be indicated.
In communications and data processing, the subset of a complete character set, including letters, numerals, punctuation marks, and other common symbols as well as the codes used to represent them.
Non-empty set of symbols or letters in computer science and mathematical logic
A non-empty set of symbols or letters in computer science or mathematical logic
A character set that includes letters and is used to write a language

bn:00247344n: A resource used in the production of goods and services
In economics, factors of production, resources, or inputs are what is utilized in the production process in order to produce output -- that is, finished goods.
Something fed into a process with the intention of it shaping or affecting the outputs of that process.
A resource used to produce goods and services, such as labor, land, or capital.
A user that performs a service, or the equipment or facility that is required for a service.
A stock of money, product, or people services used in the performance of an activity.

bn:00075652n: A symbol is an object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, visual image, belief, action, or material entity.
Symbols are things such as particular forms or marks which represent some sort of information, an idea, a physical entity or a process but is distinct from it.
In programming, a name that represents a register, an absolute value, or a memory address (relative or absolute).
A character or glyph representing an idea, concept or object.
One or a few characters, a picture or an other concrete representation of an idea, a concept and the like.
An object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, belief, action, or material entity
An arbitrary sign (written or printed) that has acquired a conventional significance
Something that represents an idea, a process, or a physical entity

bn:00056443n: Someone who is passionate about music.
Music is an art form whose medium is sound.
Music is an art form that involves sounds and silence.
A sound, or the study of such sounds, organized in time.
The artistic organization of sounds or tones that expresses ideas and emotions through the elements of rhythm, melody, harmony and tonal color.
An app that facilitates the playing of music.
Sound, organized in time in a melodious way.
An artistic form of auditory communication incorporating instrumental or vocal tones in a structured and continuous manner
The title of the hub for music and video.

bn:00003614n: A punctuation mark (&) used to represent conjunction (and).
A punctuation mark (&) used to represent conjunction (and)
An ampersand is a logogram" &" representing the conjunction word "and".
Ampersand - a logogram representing the conjunction word and

bn:00031280n: A symbol ( = ) used in mathematics to indicate that two values are the same, and elsewhere in various other ways, such as (formerly) to separate the signature from the content of a telegram.
A sign indicating that the quantities on either side are equal
Mathematical symbol used to indicate equality
The equals sign or equality sign is a mathematical symbol used to indicate equality.
